<p>This page provides a listing of current collaborations, tasks, and news about English Wikipedia. New to <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia" title="Wikipedia">Wikipedia</a>? See the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Contributing_to_Wikipedia" title="Wikipedia:Contributing to Wikipedia">contributing to Wikipedia</a> page or <a href="/wiki/Help:Introduction" title="Help:Introduction">our tutorial</a> for everything you need to know to get started. For a listing of <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:ADMINP" class="mw-redirect" title="Wikipedia:ADMINP">internal project pages</a> of interest, see the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Department_directory" title="Wikipedia:Department directory">department directory</a>.
</p>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2 ext-discussiontools-init-section"><h2 id="Community_bulletin_board" data-mw-thread-id="h-Community_bulletin_board-20250329115900"><span data-mw-comment-start="" id="h-Community_bulletin_board-20250329115900"></span>
Community bulletin board
<span data-mw-comment-end="h-Community_bulletin_board-20250329115900"></span></h2><div class="ext-discussiontools-init-section-bar"><div class="ext-discussiontools-init-section-metadata"></div><div class="ext-discussiontools-init-section-actions"></div></div></div> <span data-mw-comment-start="" id="c-Catfurball-20250807163500-Community_bulletin_board"></span><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1236090951">.mw-parser-output .hatnote{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output div.hatnote{padding-left:1.6em;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .hatnote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .hatnote+link+.hatnote{margin-top:-0.5em}@media print{body.ns-0 .mw-parser-output .hatnote{display:none!important}}</style><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable relarticle mainarticle selfreference noprint">This section is <a href="/wiki/Help:Transclusion" title="Help:Transclusion">transcluded</a> from <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Community_bulletin_board" title="Wikipedia:Community bulletin board">Wikipedia:Community bulletin board</a>. <span class="plainlinks" style="font-style: normal; font-size:85%;">(<a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Community_bulletin_board&action=edit">edit</a> | <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Community_bulletin_board&action=history">history</a>)</span></div>
<table class="mw-collapsible mw-archivedtalk mw-collapsed mw-made-collapsible" style="text-align: left; border: 1px solid var(--border-color-subtle, #c8ccd1); margin: 0.2em auto auto; width:100%; clear: both; padding: 1px;">

<tbody><tr>
<th style="background-color: var(--background-color-interactive, #eaecf0);color:inherit; font-size:87%; padding:0.2em 0.3em; text-align: left;"><button type="button" class="mw-collapsible-toggle mw-collapsible-toggle-default mw-collapsible-toggle-collapsed" aria-expanded="false" tabindex="0" style="color: inherit;"><span class="mw-collapsible-text" style="color: inherit;">show</span></button><div style="display: inline; font-size: 115%; color: var(--color-base, #202122);"><span typeof="mw:File"><a href="/wiki/File:Ambox_notice.png" class="mw-file-description"><img src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c8/Ambox_notice.png/20px-Ambox_notice.png" decoding="async" width="16" height="16" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c8/Ambox_notice.png/40px-Ambox_notice.png 1.5x" data-file-width="40" data-file-height="40"></a></span> How to add to the community bulletin board</div>
</th></tr>
<tr hidden="until-found">
<td style="border: solid 1px var(--border-color-subtle, #c8ccd1); padding: 8px; background-color: var(--background-color-base, #fff); color: var(--color-base, #202122);">
<div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1238436933"><table class="box-Notice plainlinks ombox ombox-notice" role="presentation"><tbody><tr><td class="mbox-image"><span typeof="mw:File"><span><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/1d/Information_icon4.svg/40px-Information_icon4.svg.png" decoding="async" width="40" height="40" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/1d/Information_icon4.svg/60px-Information_icon4.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/1/1d/Information_icon4.svg/120px-Information_icon4.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="620" data-file-height="620"></span></span></td><td class="mbox-text" style="text-align: left;">The community bulletin board has 2 sections that can be used by Wikipedians for announcements: "Events and projects" and "WikiProject notices". In general, keep it <b>concise</b> (under 2 lines), refrain from <b>fancy formatting</b>, and new entries should be placed at the <b>top</b> of their section.
<ul><li>Before editing, make sure you are on <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Community_bulletin_board" title="Wikipedia:Community bulletin board">Wikipedia:Community bulletin board</a>, not <a class="mw-selflink selflink">Wikipedia:Community portal</a>, where the board is transcluded.</li>
<li><b>Events and projects</b>: In this section, only organized events, projects, and/or competitions should be listed. These are organized by how often they occur:
<ul><li>The <b>Yearly</b> section is for uncommon events, like events that only occur every year, once, or irregularly. The <b>Monthly</b> section is for events that occur each month, or are always ongoing.</li></ul></li>
<li><b>WikiProject notices</b>: In this section, any announcement, request for help or other notice from a WikiProject should be listed here.
<ul><li>Entries should be signed, and ordered from newest to oldest.</li>
<li>Entries are to be removed after a period of <b>6 months</b>.</li></ul></li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table>
</div>
</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>Welcome to the <b>community bulletin board</b>, which is a page used for announcements from <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Wikiproject" class="mw-redirect" title="Wikipedia:Wikiproject">WikiProjects</a> and other groups. Included here are coordinated efforts, events, projects, and other general announcements.
</p>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1129693374"><div class="hlist" style="text-align: center">

<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Military_history/Contest" title="Wikipedia:WikiProject Military history/Contest">Monthly contest, WikiProject Military history</a>.</b> The contest department of the Military history WikiProject aims to motivate increased quality in military history articles by offering a form of friendly competition for project members making improvements to them. The primary contest available is a simple rolling competition that awards points for improving articles. The contest runs from the first to last day of each month.</li>
<li><b>Guild of Copy Editors' editing drive.  The </b><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Guild_of_Copy_Editors/Backlog_elimination_drives/July_2025" title="Wikipedia:WikiProject Guild of Copy Editors/Backlog elimination drives/July 2025">July 2025 backlog drive</a><b> was a one-month-long effort by the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:WikiProject_Guild_of_Copy_Editors" title="Wikipedia:WikiProject Guild of Copy Editors"><b>Guild of Copy Editors</b></a> to reduce the backlog of articles that require copy editing: those carrying the <span class="nowrap">{{</span><a href="/wiki/Template:Copy_edit" title="Template:Copy edit">copy edit</a><span class="nowrap">}}</span> tag (also <span class="nowrap">{{</span><a href="/wiki/Template:Awkward" class="mw-redirect" title="Template:Awkward">awkward</a><span class="nowrap">}}</span>, <span class="nowrap">{{</span><a href="/wiki/Template:Copy_edit_section" title="Template:Copy edit section">copy edit section</a><span class="nowrap">}}</span>, <span class="nowrap">{{</span><a href="/wiki/Template:Inappropriate_person" title="Template:Inappropriate person">inappropriate person</a><span class="nowrap">}}</span>, and <span class="nowrap">{{</span><a href="/wiki/Template:Copy_edit_inline" title="Template:Copy edit inline">copy edit inline</a><span class="nowrap">}}</span>, and their redirects) or are listed on the <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:GOCE/REQ" class="mw-redirect" title="Wikipedia:GOCE/REQ">GOCE Requests page</a>. <u>It began on 1 July, 00:00 (UTC), and ended on 31 July, 23:59 (UTC).</u> Stay tuned for the next event. </b></li>

<div class="wp-comm-bulletin-box wp-comm-bulletin-news">
<div class="wp-comm-bulletin-header"><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Tech_news" title="Wikipedia:Tech news">Technical news</a></div>
<link rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style" href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1236090951"><div role="note" class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable relarticle mainarticle selfreference noprint">This section is <a href="/wiki/Help:Transclusion" title="Help:Transclusion">transcluded</a> from <a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Tech_news" title="Wikipedia:Tech news">Wikipedia:Tech news</a>. <span class="plainlinks" style="font-style: normal; font-size:85%;">(<a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Tech_news&action=edit">edit</a> | <a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Tech_news&action=history">history</a>)</span></div>
<div class="plainlinks">
<p>Latest <b><a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News">tech news</a></b> from the Wikimedia technical community. Please tell other users about these changes. Not all changes will affect you. <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/2025/32" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/2025/32">Translations</a> are available.
</p><p><b>Updates for editors</b>
</p>
<ul><li>Editors can now enable the <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Product_Safety_and_Integrity/Anti-abuse_signals/User_Info" class="extiw" title="mw:Special:MyLanguage/Product Safety and Integrity/Anti-abuse signals/User Info">User Info card</a>. This feature adds an icon next to usernames on history pages and similar user-contribution log pages. When you tap or click on the icon, it displays data related to that user account such as the number of edits, reverted edits, blocks, and more. It's part of a broader project to make it easier for moderators to evaluate account trustworthiness. The feature can be enabled in <a href="https://test.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:GlobalPreferences#mw-prefsection-rendering" class="extiw" title="testwiki:Special:GlobalPreferences">your global preferences</a>, and later this week it will be available in local preferences. <a class="external autonumber" href="https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T386439">[1]</a></li>
<li>Everybody is invited to share comments on <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/CampaignEvents/Collaborative_contributions" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/CampaignEvents/Collaborative contributions">Collaborative Contributions</a>, a project recently launched by the <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Connection_Team" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/Connection Team">Connection team</a>. The project aims to create a new way to display the impact of collaborative editing activities (such as edit-a-thons, backlog drives, and WikiProjects) on the wikis. Post your comments on the <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Talk:CampaignEvents/Collaborative_contributions" class="extiw" title="m:Talk:CampaignEvents/Collaborative contributions">project talk page</a>. <a class="external autonumber" href="https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T378035">[2]</a></li>
<li>Administrators can now define the default block duration for temporary accounts. To do that, they need to create a page named <code dir="ltr">MediaWiki:Ipb-default-expiry-temporary-account</code> and use a value defined in <code dir="ltr">MediaWiki:Ipboptions</code>. This allows administrators to easily block temporary accounts for 90 days, which is functionally equivalent to an indefinite block. The advantage of this solution is that it does not clutter Special:BlockList. <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Manual:Block_and_unblock#Default_block_duration_options" class="extiw" title="mw:Special:MyLanguage/Manual:Block and unblock">More documentation</a> is available. <a class="external autonumber" href="https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T398626">[3]</a></li>
<li><span class="skin-invert" typeof="mw:File"><span title="Recurrent item"><img alt="Recurrent item" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Octicons-sync.svg/20px-Octicons-sync.svg.png" decoding="async" width="12" height="16" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Octicons-sync.svg/40px-Octicons-sync.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="768" data-file-height="1024"></span></span> View all 27 community-submitted tasks that were <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/Recently_resolved_community_tasks" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/Recently resolved community tasks">resolved last week</a>.</li></ul>
<p><b>Updates for technical contributors</b>
</p>
<ul><li>Gadgets can now include <code dir="ltr">.vue</code> files. This makes it easier to develop modern user interfaces using <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Vue.js" class="extiw" title="mw:Vue.js">Vue.js</a>, in particular using <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Codex" class="extiw" title="mw:Special:MyLanguage/Codex">Codex</a>, the official design system of Wikimedia. <a href="https://doc.wikimedia.org/codex/latest/icons/overview.html" class="extiw" title="wmdoc:codex/latest/icons/overview.html">Codex icons</a> can be loaded through the gadget definition. <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Extension:Gadgets#Pages" class="extiw" title="mw:Special:MyLanguage/Extension:Gadgets">The documentation</a> has examples. For user scripts that use Vue.js, an <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/API:CodexIcons" class="extiw" title="mw:API:CodexIcons">API module</a> now exists to load Codex icons. <a class="external autonumber" href="https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T340460">[4]</a><a class="external autonumber" href="https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T311099">[5]</a></li>
<li>Module developers can now use a <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:Extension:Translate/Message_Bundles/Lua_reference" class="extiw" title="mw:Help:Extension:Translate/Message Bundles/Lua reference">Lua interface</a> to simplify the preparation of Lua modules for translation on Meta-Wiki. This improvement makes it easier for translators to find and edit module strings without dealing with raw Lua code. It helps prevent mistakes that could break the module during translation. Module developers and translators are invited to <a href="https://commons.wikimedia.org/wiki/File:Translatable_modules_video_demo_July_2025.webm" class="extiw" title="commons:File:Translatable modules video demo July 2025.webm">watch the demo video</a>, read more about <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Translatable_modules" class="extiw" title="mw:Special:MyLanguage/Translatable modules">translatable modules</a> to understand how it works, refer to Meta-Wiki's <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Module:User_Wikimedia_project" class="extiw" title="m:Module:User Wikimedia project">Module:User Wikimedia project</a> for example usage, and <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Talk:Translatable_modules" class="extiw" title="mw:Talk:Translatable modules">share their feedback</a> on how well it addresses the challenges in their workflow. The interface still has some performance issues, so it should not be used in widely used modules yet. <a class="external autonumber" href="https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T359918">[6]</a></li>
<li>Developers of external tools that connect to Wikimedia pages must set a user-agent that complies with <a href="https://foundation.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Policy:Wikimedia_Foundation_User-Agent_Policy" class="extiw" title="foundation:Special:MyLanguage/Policy:Wikimedia Foundation User-Agent Policy">the user-agent policy</a>. This policy will start to be more strongly enforced in August because of external crawlers that are <a href="https://diff.wikimedia.org/2025/04/01/how-crawlers-impact-the-operations-of-the-wikimedia-projects/" class="extiw" title="diffblog:2025/04/01/how-crawlers-impact-the-operations-of-the-wikimedia-projects/">overusing</a> Wikimedia's resources. Tools that are hosted on Wikimedia's Toolforge or Cloud VPS will not be affected by this for now, but should still set a user-agent. <a href="https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T400119" class="extiw" title="phab:T400119">More technical details are available</a>, and related questions are welcome in that task.</li>
<li>Parsoid Read Views is going to be rolling out to some smaller Wikipedias over the next few weeks, following the successful transition of Wikivoyages and Wiktionaries to Parsoid Read Views. For more information, see the <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Parsoid/Parser_Unification" class="extiw" title="mw:Special:MyLanguage/Parsoid/Parser Unification">Parsoid/Parser Unification</a> project page. <a class="external autonumber" href="https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/project/profile/7694/">[7]</a></li>
<li><span class="skin-invert" typeof="mw:File"><span title="Recurrent item"><img alt="Recurrent item" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Octicons-sync.svg/20px-Octicons-sync.svg.png" decoding="async" width="12" height="16" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1a/Octicons-sync.svg/40px-Octicons-sync.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="768" data-file-height="1024"></span></span> Detailed code updates later this week: <a href="https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/MediaWiki_1.45/wmf.13" class="extiw" title="mw:MediaWiki 1.45/wmf.13">MediaWiki</a></li></ul>
<p><b>Meetings and events</b>
</p>
<ul><li><a href="https://wikimania.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/2025:Wikimania" class="extiw" title="wmania:Special:MyLanguage/2025:Wikimania">Wikimania 2025</a> will run from August 69. The <a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://wikimedia.eventyay.com/talk/wikimania2025/schedule/">program is available</a> for you to plan which sessions you want to attend. Most sessions will be live-streamed, with exceptions for those that show the "no camera" icon. If you are joining online to watch live-streams and use the interactive features, please <a href="https://wikimania.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/2025:Registration" class="extiw" title="wmania:Special:MyLanguage/2025:Registration">register</a> for a free virtual ticket. For example, you may be interested in technical sessions such as:
<ul><li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://wikimedia.eventyay.com/talk/wikimania2025/talk/GEH9DH/">Wikimedias knowledge infrastructure in a changing internet: Establishing sustainable pathways for content reuse</a></li>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://wikimedia.eventyay.com/talk/wikimania2025/talk/7ELN9Q/">Wikifunctions is coming soon to a wiki near you!</a></li>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://wikimedia.eventyay.com/talk/wikimania2025/talk/ZMGVJV/">Shaping the Future of Wikipedias Reader Experience</a></li>
<li><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="https://wikimedia.eventyay.com/talk/wikimania2025/talk/KCKTFZ/">Making Wikipedia More Readable: What Comes Next</a></li></ul></li></ul>
<p><i><b><a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News">Tech news</a></b> prepared by <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/Writers" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/Writers">Tech News writers</a> and posted by <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/User:MediaWiki_message_delivery" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/User:MediaWiki message delivery">bot</a>  <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News#contribute" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News">Contribute</a>  <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/2025/32" class="extiw" title="m:Special:MyLanguage/Tech/News/2025/32">Translate</a>  <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Tech" class="extiw" title="m:Tech">Get help</a>  <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Talk:Tech/News" class="extiw" title="m:Talk:Tech/News">Give feedback</a>  <a href="https://meta.wikimedia.org/wiki/Global_message_delivery/Targets/Tech_ambassadors" class="extiw" title="m:Global message delivery/Targets/Tech ambassadors">Subscribe or unsubscribe</a>.</i>
</p>
</div>
</div>

<div class="mw-heading mw-heading2 ext-discussiontools-init-section"><h2 id="Tip_of_the_day" data-mw-thread-id="h-Tip_of_the_day"><span data-mw-comment-start="" id="h-Tip_of_the_day"></span>
Tip of the day
<span data-mw-comment-end="h-Tip_of_the_day"></span></h2></div> 
<div role="complementary" aria-labelledby="totd-label" style="overflow:hidden; box-sizing:border-box; margin:0.5em auto 0; border:solid medium #ADD8E6; border-radius:15px; width:90%; padding:1.4em 0.9em 1em 1.2em;">
<div id="totd-label" style="font-size:90%;"><a href="/wiki/Wikipedia:Tip_of_the_day" title="Wikipedia:Tip of the day">Tip of the day...</a></div>
<figure class="mw-halign-right" typeof="mw:File"><span><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Simple_light_bulb_graphic.png/120px-Simple_light_bulb_graphic.png" decoding="async" width="120" height="125" class="mw-file-element" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/6/64/Simple_light_bulb_graphic.png/250px-Simple_light_bulb_graphic.png 1.5x" data-file-width="717" data-file-height="744"></span><figcaption></figcaption></figure>
<div class="center"><span style="font-size:120%"><b>How to search Wikipedia with Google/Bing</b></span></div>
<p>To limit Google or Bing searches to the English Wikipedia, include this in your search string: <b>site:en.wikipedia.org</b>.
</p><p>You can even do a Google search of Wikipedia from Wikipedia's own search box! For example, to use Google to search for pages with "geology" in the title, type this into WP's search box:  <var>google:geology+site:en.wikipedia.org</var>
</p><p>This link does the same thing:  <var><a href="//www.google.com/search?q=geology%2Bsite:en.wikipedia.org" class="extiw" title="google:geology+site:en.wikipedia.org">google:geology+site:en.wikipedia.org</a></var>.
</p><p>Another way is to use Google's or Bing's advanced settings. (To get there from Google's or Bing's search page, click on the gear icon).
</p>

Welcome to the community portal! 
Shortcuts
P:WP
WP:COM

This page provides a listing of current collaborations, tasks, and news about English Wikipedia. New to Wikipedia? See the contributing to Wikipedia page or our tutorial for everything you need to know to get started. For a listing of internal project pages of interest, see the department directory.

Interact more 

For a listing of ongoing discussions and current requests, see the Dashboard.

Community bulletin board 
This section is transcluded from Wikipedia:Community bulletin board. (edit | history)
show
 How to add to the community bulletin board

	The community bulletin board has 2 sections that can be used by Wikipedians for announcements: "Events and projects" and "WikiProject notices". In general, keep it concise (under 2 lines), refrain from fancy formatting, and new entries should be placed at the top of their section.
Before editing, make sure you are on Wikipedia:Community bulletin board, not Wikipedia:Community portal, where the board is transcluded.
Events and projects: In this section, only organized events, projects, and/or competitions should be listed. These are organized by how often they occur:
The Yearly section is for uncommon events, like events that only occur every year, once, or irregularly. The Monthly section is for events that occur each month, or are always ongoing.
WikiProject notices: In this section, any announcement, request for help or other notice from a WikiProject should be listed here.
Entries should be signed, and ordered from newest to oldest.
Entries are to be removed after a period of 6 months.

Welcome to the community bulletin board, which is a page used for announcements from WikiProjects and other groups. Included here are coordinated efforts, events, projects, and other general announcements.

Dashboard

Events and projects [add]

Yearly or infrequent events

Monthly or continuous events

Monthly contest, WikiProject Military history. The contest department of the Military history WikiProject aims to motivate increased quality in military history articles by offering a form of friendly competition for project members making improvements to them. The primary contest available is a simple rolling competition that awards points for improving articles. The contest runs from the first to last day of each month.
Guild of Copy Editors' editing drive. The July 2025 backlog drive was a one-month-long effort by the Guild of Copy Editors to reduce the backlog of articles that require copy editing: those carrying the {{copy edit}} tag (also {{awkward}}, {{copy edit section}}, {{inappropriate person}}, and {{copy edit inline}}, and their redirects) or are listed on the GOCE Requests page. It began on 1 July, 00:00 (UTC), and ended on 31 July, 23:59 (UTC). Stay tuned for the next event.
Wikipedia:WikiProject Women in Red 2025 Events:
Recently completed:	Alphabet run: M & N Women in Red turns 10 Geofocus: Ten for Kenya
New this month:	Alphabet run: O & P Indigenous women Film and stage

WikiProject notices [add]

Also consider posting WikiProject, Task Force, and Collaboration news at The Signpost's WikiProject Report page. Please include your signature when adding a listing here.

WP Unreferenced articles is trying to clear the decades-long backlog of unreferenced articles. The backlog recently reached under 49,000. Come contribute! Catfurball (talk) 16:35, 7 August 2025 (UTC)
WikiProject Haiti is newly renovated and looking for interested participants. Averageuntitleduser (talk) 15:38, 21 July 2025 (UTC)
WikiProject Kabbalah is re-activating as there are a lot of maintenance templates on these articles and new references and inline citations are needed. See Kabbalah Books Online. New participants welcome!! Nnev66 (talk) 23:07, 26 May 2025 (UTC)
WikiProject Christianity is back and running! We are looking for new and interested editors to join. We look forward to working with you! Sheriff U3 12:51, 5 April 2025 (UTC)

Technical news
This section is transcluded from Wikipedia:Tech news. (edit | history)

Latest tech news from the Wikimedia technical community. Please tell other users about these changes. Not all changes will affect you. Translations are available.

Updates for editors

Editors can now enable the User Info card. This feature adds an icon next to usernames on history pages and similar user-contribution log pages. When you tap or click on the icon, it displays data related to that user account such as the number of edits, reverted edits, blocks, and more. It's part of a broader project to make it easier for moderators to evaluate account trustworthiness. The feature can be enabled in your global preferences, and later this week it will be available in local preferences. [1]
Everybody is invited to share comments on Collaborative Contributions, a project recently launched by the Connection team. The project aims to create a new way to display the impact of collaborative editing activities (such as edit-a-thons, backlog drives, and WikiProjects) on the wikis. Post your comments on the project talk page. [2]
Administrators can now define the default block duration for temporary accounts. To do that, they need to create a page named MediaWiki:Ipb-default-expiry-temporary-account and use a value defined in MediaWiki:Ipboptions. This allows administrators to easily block temporary accounts for 90 days, which is functionally equivalent to an indefinite block. The advantage of this solution is that it does not clutter Special:BlockList. More documentation is available. [3]
 View all 27 community-submitted tasks that were resolved last week.

Updates for technical contributors

Gadgets can now include .vue files. This makes it easier to develop modern user interfaces using Vue.js, in particular using Codex, the official design system of Wikimedia. Codex icons can be loaded through the gadget definition. The documentation has examples. For user scripts that use Vue.js, an API module now exists to load Codex icons. [4][5]
Module developers can now use a Lua interface to simplify the preparation of Lua modules for translation on Meta-Wiki. This improvement makes it easier for translators to find and edit module strings without dealing with raw Lua code. It helps prevent mistakes that could break the module during translation. Module developers and translators are invited to watch the demo video, read more about translatable modules to understand how it works, refer to Meta-Wiki's Module:User Wikimedia project for example usage, and share their feedback on how well it addresses the challenges in their workflow. The interface still has some performance issues, so it should not be used in widely used modules yet. [6]
Developers of external tools that connect to Wikimedia pages must set a user-agent that complies with the user-agent policy. This policy will start to be more strongly enforced in August because of external crawlers that are overusing Wikimedia's resources. Tools that are hosted on Wikimedia's Toolforge or Cloud VPS will not be affected by this for now, but should still set a user-agent. More technical details are available, and related questions are welcome in that task.
Parsoid Read Views is going to be rolling out to some smaller Wikipedias over the next few weeks, following the successful transition of Wikivoyages and Wiktionaries to Parsoid Read Views. For more information, see the Parsoid/Parser Unification project page. [7]
 Detailed code updates later this week: MediaWiki

Meetings and events

Wikimania 2025 will run from August 69. The program is available for you to plan which sessions you want to attend. Most sessions will be live-streamed, with exceptions for those that show the "no camera" icon. If you are joining online to watch live-streams and use the interactive features, please register for a free virtual ticket. For example, you may be interested in technical sessions such as:
Wikimedias knowledge infrastructure in a changing internet: Establishing sustainable pathways for content reuse
Wikifunctions is coming soon to a wiki near you!

How to search Wikipedia with Google/Bing

To limit Google or Bing searches to the English Wikipedia, include this in your search string: site:en.wikipedia.org.

You can even do a Google search of Wikipedia from Wikipedia's own search box! For example, to use Google to search for pages with "geology" in the title, type this into WP's search box: google:geology+site:en.wikipedia.org

This link does the same thing: google:geology+site:en.wikipedia.org.

Another way is to use Google's or Bing's advanced settings. (To get there from Google's or Bing's search page, click on the gear icon).
